title: Matcha Phở
ingredients: - 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon Mushroom Seasoning Powder, homemade or store-bought
- 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon sriracha, or more to taste
- 12 ounces dried sweet potato starch noodles (dangmyeon), soaked in cold water for 30 minutes and drained well, or 1 pound narrow flat rice noodles (bánh phở)
- 1 cup lightly packed Thai basil leaves, roughly chopped cilantro, or a mixture
directions: 1. Bring at least 5 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot.
2. When the water boils, scoop 6 cups into a medium pot. Add the ginger-scallion sauce, hoisin sauce, mushroom seasoning powder, and sriracha. Stir well and season with salt. Cover to keep warm.
3. Add the noodles to the large pot of boiling water and cook, stirring once, until done to your liking according to the package instructions. Drain them well.
4. Divide the broth among four serving bowls.
5. Divide the noodles evenly into each bowl.
6. Sift the matcha powder over the bowls using a sifter or fine-mesh strainer.
7. Top each bowl with bean sprouts and herbs.
